page.title: 09THE JACK AND JILL PUB
page.content: The Jack and Jill pub is on the Burgess Hill to Brighton road at the end of Clayton Tunnel near the Jack and Jill Windmills. It used to be the village store and post office, then called the 'Matsfield Arms' before changing to the 'Jack and Jill'. It has a large well maintained garden with a children's play area and a car park. The landlord has been at this pub for 15 years. Very few of the villagers use the pub so most customers drive there. 7O% of the trade is regular. Many families use the pub in summer because of the garden. There is also a family room inside. Food is sold. The busiest time is on Sunday morning. There are 8 employees with 4 on at any one time. The landlord complains about the untidy state in which his garden is left. Hundreds of glasses are stolen.
